intro: Hieracium acanthodon, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are rough and hairy, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Hieracium acanthodon is often found in open habitats and can be a common weed in agricultural areas.
